title: Rebuild GitHub skill with progressive disclosure architecture
description: ⚠️ REQUIRES OPUS - architectural skill design. Restructure the GitHub skill from a monolithic reference doc into a progressive disclosure architecture. SKILL.md becomes a ~50 line router, workflow files contain imperative instructions, and scripts handle deterministic operations. Follow docs/skill-creation-guide.md patterns.

acceptanceCriteria.text: SKILL.md is <100 lines, contains only routing logic and prerequisites check
Create workflows/commits.md with imperative commit workflow
Create workflows/issues.md with create/view/close issue workflows
Create workflows/pull-requests.md with create/view/merge PR workflows
Create workflows/troubleshooting.md with GITHUB_TOKEN fix and auth issues
Create scripts/smart-commit.sh that handles staging, committing, co-author
Create scripts/pre-push-check.sh that validates before push
All workflow files use imperative language (Run:, Verify:, If error:)
Description includes trigger keywords: commit, push, PR, issue, git, github
Test: /github loads router, not full reference
Test: 'create an issue' loads only issues.md workflow
